reviews.text: Garth cottage is so much more than your typical B&B. For me, a good B&B has to do two things well. The first being Bed and the second, of course Breakfast. The bed was deliciously comfortable with high quality mattress, duvet and sheets. The breakfasts were outstanding - some 5* London hotels would struggle to match the cooked breakfasts that Mark magically conjures up! So that's two big ticks right there, but what makes this place stand out by quite some margin is the hosts. We could not have possibly asked for anything more given a million years! The Eden family are unbelievably accommodating, generous, kind, incredibly interesting and a real pleasure to stay with. We felt as though we had known them for years! I can't even explain just how fabulous our 2 night stay was! We felt right at home which is why people choose a B&B over a hotel in the first place,but these guys are different beasts altogether! A huge thank you again to Mark, Val and Bertie. I can say with confidence that we will be back! We only got home yesterday and are already trying to make space in the diary for our next visit!!!!
reviews.title: We didn't want to leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived, greeted by Mark with a tray of tea and cakes to the morning we left, nothing was too much trouble. One of the best B&B's we have stayed in. The room (No 4) was not overlarge but was more than adequate for our needs; very comfortable with a lovely bed and the shower / toilet was fine. Mark is an excellent chef, so be aware to pre book dinner; the variety of his dishes is great. This is definitely one to go onto the 'must visit again ' list. We stayed just two nights but it will be more next time.
reviews.title: What a Cottage!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely guest house in a lovely setting. Our room was large with a great view of the river (our host said all their rooms had river views). It had a good sized bathroom - no bath but a large shower. Everywhere was spotlessly clean. Unusually for now-a-days there was no TV in the room, though the downstairs lounge had a large flat screen which would suffice if you were desperate not to miss anything! Breakfast was cooked perfectly. Despite a time window of just 8:30 to 9:00, our host offered to make breakfast earlier if we wanted so it wasn't an issue.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: As to our hosts, they were most friendly, very chatty, very accommodating and helpful. Lovely people. All in all I can highly recommend staying here and fully expect to return someday myself
reviews.title: superb accommodation in perfect situation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great 4 nights we have just had.From the greeting, being met at the private parking and helped with baggage, to the friendly approach given by Val Eden and her son Mark. This really is a gem of a b&b. The room was comfortable,the choice of food for the next days breakfast comprehensive,matched only by its taste. If you can plan an evening meal in advance then Mark will serve up one to savour.I was even offered the use of his garage to correct a fault on my classic car.Add this to being in probably the prettiest setting in arguably one of the finest areas we have visited, i can only say we'll be back.
reviews.title: perfect b&b

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in September for a couple of nights. We were given a warm reception and a fantastic room overlooking the river. Mark and his mum were very accommodating and helpful during our stay as well as offering suggestions for the second part of our trip. We would definitely stay here again, and give it a good recommendation.
reviews.title: Great B&B, comfortable room

reviews.text: I booked Garth Cottage for a overnight stay for Saturday for me and my mum as we had a spa day booked on the Sunday. We wanted to stay on this strip but the Royal Lodge and Saracans Head were both fully booked but luckilly I came across this B&B who had availability.
reviews.title: Wonderful overnight stay at Garth Cottage!
Lovely, homely B and B
reviews.text: On arrival we were greeted by Mark and shown to our twin room (room 5) and offered tea and yummy Medeira cake! As it was such a beautiful hot day we sat out the front of the B&B overlooking the river for hours, we got very comfy and so couldn't move and became very lazy!! We chatted to Mark and his lovely parents until dinner time. Mark took our orders for breakfast and we chose exactly what we wanted.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a stroll to the Royal Lodge for a drink and then drove into Monmouth for dinner. We arrived back at 11.30pm and again greeted by Mark who directed me into my car park space.
reviews.title: a very warm welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was lovely, clean and airy with a modern ensuite shower and toilet but the best part was the view! We could see up and down the river, was an excellent view.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Garth Cottage at the end of September for 3 nights for my birthday weekend away. We were greeted by Mark, Val and Bertie with a welcoming cup of tea and our bags were carried to our clean, homely room with perfect views of the River.
reviews.title: Lovely weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mark is a chef and we must say that the two evening meals that we ate at Garth Cottage were probably the best meals we have ever had the pleasure to eat. Beautiful homemade pate, steak in a gorgeous red wine and mushroon sauce to name one meal...wonderful! If you stay at Garth Cottage you really should try at least one meal in. Breakfasts fab too!
reviews.title: Late Booking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In an ideal position for walking, we walked to Monmouth and back one day, around 12 miles, went up to Yat Rock for breathtaking views and shopped in Hereford, where there are lots of shops.
reviews.title: Saved the Day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would we go back?......don't be silly, of course we will. Thank you for making our stay perfect. Sue & Kevin.
reviews.title: Perfect hideaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic few day at the end of August. Only booked the 3 nights the Friday before. Traveled down on the August bank holiday Monday. Got a warm welcome from Mark and Val and a parking bay right out side. Given a cup of tea and a seat before being shown to the room. OK for all you that like to find DUST!! YES there was dust but I had to wet one finger and run it along the top of all the pictures in the room before I found one with a little dust on it. I looked out of the window it the river WYE and the view up the valley and stopped looking for faults just relaxed and totaly enjoyed the few day we stayed there. Mark and Val could not do enough to make us fIll welcome. giving us the low down on were to eat and the best walks. WE WILL BE BACK.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't really add anything to previous reviews- it's all absolutely true! Mark and his mum Val made us really welcome, with a pot of tea on the outdoor terrace when we arrived. The room was really clean and well stocked with tea/coffee making making facilities and toiletries, and I had to tear myself away from the view to go downstairs and start exploring. The dining room has the same great view, but it's easy to forget it once you experience Mark's cooking. Poached haddock, kippers, eggs Benedict, smoked salmon on toasted English muffin...or a beautiful FRESHLY COOKED full English? Life can be so difficult! Mark also does evening meals with enough notice, and although we didn't have one they looked just as good. He also has a really well-stocked little bar-the cold lager was a real winner after a long walk on a hot day and it was great to be able to sit outside with it under the sun umbrella on the terrace watching the river go by. Would go back there like a shot. We found them by Googling 'Garth Cottage' & booked by e-mail, but you can phone too.
reviews.title: English gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights & had excellent dinners on both.Mark has first class culinary skills & we would recommend the results to anyone.The rooms were spotless & the rivers views spectacular. We had welcome tea & cake on the patio when we arrived.Mark & Val are the perfect hosts & you will want for nothing .Strangers are friends within minutes of arriving.This is a very comfortable place to be & our hosts deserve great credit for our lovely relaxing break in a beautiful part of the country.
reviews.title: You will receive a lovely welcome to this B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nancy & Peter
reviews.title: Special B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights over the Jubilee weekend whilst canoeing. Mark was the perfect host for the weekend. the room was very nice with lovely views over the river. Breakfast was superb. Please if you stay have a drink in the bar with Mark he makes an excellent Bloody Mary!! we had a brilliant weekend.
reviews.title: what more can I say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A wonderful welcome with free parking. Mark, Val & Bertie could not have been better hosts. We were also in room 2 which was very comfortable and the views were amazing. Marks cooking is wonderful and I would recommend the evening meals as well as breakfast.It is a beautiful place to stay. We were there for 4 nights and will definately be going back.
reviews.title: Lovely welcome & great weekend
